item.title: Russia not easing Ukraine crisis would be 'expensive mistake' John Kerry
item.description: Secretary of state warns unless Moscow takes steps to de-escalate situation, Washington would impose more sanctions Continue reading...

media:content.media:description: John Kerry said Russia had actively stoked tensions in eastern Ukraine by engaging in inflammatory rhetoric. Photograph: Alex Wong/Getty Images

item.title: Ukraine crisis: Vladimir Putin warns of 'consequences' after Slavyansk skirmish
item.description:
Russian troops manoeuvre on the border after Kiev government attempts to wrest back control of city
Continue reading...
item.dc:creator: Luke Harding in Slavyansk and Julian Borger

media:content.media:description: Ukrainian soldiers carry out a raid on a pro-Russian roadblock in Karpivka, north of Slavyansk. Photograph: Pierre Crom/Sipa/Rex
Vyacheslav Ponomarev, the self-appointed pro-Russian mayor of Slavyansk. Photograph: Brendan Hoffman/Getty Images
US journalist Simon Ostrovsky is heading for Donetsk after being held by insurgents for several days. Photograph: Alexander Khudoteply/AFP/Getty Images
A member of the Ukrainian special forces takes position at an abandoned roadblock in the separatist-held eastern town of Slavyansk. Photograph: Kirill Kudryavtsev/AFP
A member of the Ukrainian special forces takes position at an abandoned roadblock in the separatist-held eastern town of Slavyansk. Photograph: Kirill Kudryavtsev/AFP

item.title: Vyacheslav Ponomarev: the 'people's mayor' who runs Slavyansk
item.description: Public face and apparent leader of pro-Russian separatists in city was previously little-known even in the area Continue reading...
item.dc:creator: Alec Luhn

media:content.media:description: Vyacheslav Ponomarev holds his daily news conference in Slavyansk. Photograph: Brendan Hoffman/Getty Images
Vyacheslav Ponomarev holds his daily news conference in Slavyansk. Photograph: Brendan Hoffman/Getty Images

item.title: Ukraine: government troops move against pro-Russia separatists - live
item.description:
• Ukrainian troops move into Slavyansk and Donetsk
  • Russian armour on the move in border area
  • Kiev asks Moscow for explanation 'within 48 hours'
  • Putin warns of 'consequences' for military action
  • Read the latest blog summary
Continue reading...
item.dc:creator: Mark Tran in London and Tom McCarthy and Alan Yuhas in New York

media:content.media:description: A Ukrainian officer is deployed at a checkpoint set on fire and left by pro-Russian separatists near Slavyansk. Photograph: Gleb Garanich/Reuters
A Ukrainian officer is deployed at a checkpoint set on fire and left by pro-Russian separatists near Slavyansk. Photograph: Gleb Garanich/Reuters
Ukrainian officers walk past a checkpoint set on fire and left by pro-Russian separatists near Slavyansk. Photograph: Gleb Garanich/reuters
Ukrainian officers walk past a checkpoint set on fire and left by pro-Russian separatists near Slavyansk. Photograph: Gleb Garanich/reuters
Members of a Polish paratrooper unit assemble before the arrival of soldiers of the US Army 173rd airborne brigade at a Polish air force base in Swidwin, Poland. Photograph: Sean Gallup/Getty Images
Members of a Polish paratrooper unit assemble before the arrival of soldiers of the US Army 173rd airborne brigade at a Polish air force base in Swidwin, Poland. Photograph: Sean Gallup/Getty Images
The wife of Donetsk deputy Vladimir Rybak mourns next to his coffin during a funeral in the village of Horlivka, in eastern Ukraine. Photograph: MARKO DJURICA/REUTERS
The wife of Donetsk deputy Vladimir Rybak mourns next to his coffin during a funeral in the village of Horlivka, in eastern Ukraine. Photograph: MARKO DJURICA/REUTERS
Ukrainian special forces take position in eastern Ukrainian city of Slavyansk on Thursday. Photograph: Kirill Kudryavtsev/AFP/Getty Images
Ukrainian special forces take position in eastern Ukrainian city of Slavyansk on Thursday. Photograph: Kirill Kudryavtsev/AFP/Getty Images
